Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya smashed 39 runs off 16 deliveries as India cruised past the target of 128 with 49 deliveries left and seven wickets in hand.
Varun Chakravarthy and Arshdeep Singh took 3 wickets apiece as Bangladesh were skittled out for just 127.
Mehidy Hasan Miraz with 35 runs was the highest run scorer for Bangladesh.
Suryakumar Yadav’s India won the toss and opted to bowl first.
Mayank Yadav and Nitish Kumar Reddy were handed debut caps.
Arshdeep Singh was named Player of the Match for his 3/14 performance.
India beat Bangladesh by 7 wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage.
The pitch was expected to be batting-friendly with no dew issues, making it conducive for a high-scoring game.
Suryakumar Yadav mentioned that Sanju Samson would open the innings throughout the series.
The newly-constructed Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Cricket Stadium hosted its first international match.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and mentioned areas for improvement.
Najmul Hossain Shanto acknowledged the need for better planning and execution in the next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the newly-constructed Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Cricket Stadium in Gwalior.
The stadium witnessed a full house with enthusiastic spectators.
